meanings.definition: To form a new concept or idea
meanings.sent1: She reconceptualizes her art by trying different colors and shapes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist reconceptualizes the theory after new evidence is discovered.
meanings.sent3: The teacher reconceptualizes the lesson plan to make it more engaging for students.
meanings.sent4: His dream reconceptualizes reality, blending fantasy with everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The architect reconceptualizes the building, turning it into a modern masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To rethink or reinterpret something in a new way
meanings.sent1: He reconceptualizes his approach to problem-solving to be more efficient.
meanings.sent2: The author reconceptualizes the ending of the story for a surprising twist.
meanings.sent3: The chef reconceptualizes the traditional dish with a unique fusion of flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her perspective reconceptualizes the world, seeing beauty in unexpected places.
meanings.sent5: The designer reconceptualizes fashion, creating bold and innovative designs.
